reviewText: I purchased this movie because I am a Graham Greene fan, and the movie kept showing up on recommended lists as a Native American movie.  This is not a Native American movie, this is a movie about saving our environment and the fortitude of a young man named Simon Jackson.When I watched the movie, I was totally moved by its presentation and portrayals.  It reminded me of years gone by, when environmentalists picked environmental causes, not political causes; when a hand few of determined people could really bring about something great.  And it is great family entertainment, that is educational as well.  Not recommended for people worried about money or jobs; Marxists need not watch.Update--1 July 2008: If this review was not helpful to you, I would appreciate learning the reason(s) so I can improve my reviews.  My goal is to provide help to potential buyers, not get into any arguments.  So, if you only disagree with my opinion, could you please say so in the comments and not indicate that the review was not helpful.  Thanks.UPDATE--December 16, 2010:  I was left a comment today that I had failed to mention a very critical aspect of "Spirit Bear": it is based upon the actual events surrounding Simon Jackson's efforts to protect this beautiful and special sub-population of bears!  I wish to thank CB,RN for pointing out that I failed to include this fact that "Spirit Bear" is based upon a true story.--Karl
summary: A Wonerful, Suprising Movie That Everyone Needs To See

reviewText: (WARNING MAY HAVE SPOILERS)I just finished watching this film this afternoon,on a family home entertainment disc I brought from a local Sears store for $5.00.The Disc had 3 other films on it.This movie "Spirit Bear" is worth Amazons asking price by it's self.This movie has been popping up on my Amz recommandation for a while,and the fact Graham Green is in it along with a rediculaouse low price made it a no-brainer.The Movie: young Jackson is out hiking along a stream ,when a brown bear approaches quite meansingly.In what looks like a  Hollwood just in timer-a rare white bear comes too his aid.After fending off the brown bear,The white bear comes and sit with Jackson.These events along with a meeting with Greens charecter-who explains about the Spirit Bear-sets off a spark in Jackson too go up against the odds and fight major logging-in the name of the Spirit Bear,and the Earth.It is a real life "Rocky" story .One other interesting thing is he is not out for a all out win,but is thinking interms of compermises(by mid film) too benifit both parties.While the big time logging company's C.E.O is as always just tring too fill his pockets-while making it like he cares about the comunity,and the land.There is a debate scene-where it demastrates the imaturity of the Tough C.E.O-cuttiing off Jackson at every turn,with his blatent play on words.This is one of the boys first major obsticals he needs too over come,and the plight gets tougher as he's ran off the road,locked out of nagotiations(due too age).The fear Jackson puts into the big shot politions ,and logging company ,by not quitting and ralling 1000's too his cause(one of which is the c.e.os step daughter) is nothing short of outstanding.A final note -Fan's of Forever Knight whould remember Dr.Lambert-Well she is in this movie too,she plays Jacksons teacher.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a really good movie for kids and based on a true person/event, but I have to give it 4-stars for the little bumps in the filming.  There are several instances where you ask yourself ~ Why was that in the movie?  You have to remember that this is a movie for kids, so not every adult is going to enjoy it.  But there are so few movies out there for kids to watch that are clean and wholesome, that you just have to ignore the poor acting and moments of terrible filming.  It is a Canadian film and there are a few instances of questionable language included. (Burn in he**, a**, bloody, friggin, stupid) This film deals with doing the right thing and fighting for what you think is right. There is a character who likes to shoplift, but the main character does not approve of it.  In the end the two teenagers engage in a simple kiss.  If your children are into animals they should like this movie.  I believe its speed and subject matter is best suited for children 8 and up.

reviewText: I bought this movie by chance from a movie rental store that was going out of business.It is a wonderful movie about a true story. A Canadian teenager who encounters a white bear in British Columbia successfully organizes a campaign to save a unique bear subspecies habitat.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Cute low budget B film. Very straight forward telling of a story about a teen environmental activist who with determination gets something done! He manages to save a unique and beautiful population of bears and their habitat in BC against all odds.It seems aimed at a younger audience and TV level. I hope it hits its target. Young people are so cynical today about being pushed around while their future is decided for them by Big Money and cheap politics. They actually do have more power than they are being led to believe. I think this film makes this important point clearly though not over-dramatically.The production values are not tops, but they are just fine and the story is very interesting.You need to google to find out more about the youth Simon Jackson and his crusade and success, because there are no extra features. It is a fascinating story and would have deserved some background material.
